examples.description: Generates an Nx plugin project called `plugins-my-plugin` at `libs/plugins/my-plugin`. The project will have an npm package name and import path of `@myorg/my-plugin`.

directory.description: A directory where the plugin is placed.
directory.x-prompt: Which directory do you want to create the plugin in?

importPath.description: How the plugin will be published, like `@myorg/my-awesome-plugin`. Note this must be a valid NPM name.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update tsconfig.json for development experience.

skipLintChecks.description: Do not eslint configuration for plugin json files.

e2eTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for end to end (E2E) tests.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

compiler.description: The compiler used by the build and test targets.

publishable.description: Generates a boilerplate for publishing the plugin to npm.

useProjectJson.description: Use a `project.json` configuration file instead of inlining the Nx configuration in the `package.json` file.
